Events.year: 762 – Baghdad is founded.
Events.html: 762 – Baghdad is founded.

Events.year: 1419 – First Defenestration of Prague: A crowd of radical Hussites kill seven members of the Prague city council.
Events.html: 1419 – First Defenestration of Prague: A crowd of radical Hussites kill seven members of the Prague city council.

Events.year: 1502 – Christopher Columbus lands at Guanaja in the Bay Islands off the coast of Honduras during his fourth voyage.
Events.html: 1502 – Christopher Columbus lands at Guanaja in the Bay Islands off the coast of Honduras during his fourth voyage.

Events.year: 1609 – Beaver Wars: At Ticonderoga (now Crown Point, New York), Samuel de Champlain shoots and kills two Iroquois chiefs on behalf of his native allies.
Events.html: 1609 – Beaver Wars: At Ticonderoga (now Crown Point, New York), Samuel de Champlain shoots and kills two Iroquois chiefs on behalf of his native allies.

Events.year: 1619 – In Jamestown, Virginia, the first Colonial European representative assembly in the Americas, the House of Burgesses, convenes for the first time.
Events.html: 1619 – In Jamestown, Virginia, the first Colonial European representative assembly in the Americas, the House of Burgesses, convenes for the first time.

Events.year: 1626 – An earthquake in Naples, Italy, kills about 10,000 people.
Events.html: 1626 – An earthquake in Naples, Italy, kills about 10,000 people.

Events.year: 1635 – Eighty Years' War: The Siege of Schenkenschans begins; Frederick Henry, Prince of Orange, begins the recapture of the strategically important fortress from the Spanish Army.
Events.html: 1635 – Eighty Years' War: The Siege of Schenkenschans begins; Frederick Henry, Prince of Orange, begins the recapture of the strategically important fortress from the Spanish Army.

Events.year: 1656 – Swedish forces under the command of King Charles X Gustav defeat the forces of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth at the Battle of Warsaw.
Events.html: 1656 – Swedish forces under the command of King Charles X Gustav defeat the forces of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth at the Battle of Warsaw.

Events.year: 1676 – Nathaniel Bacon issues the "Declaration of the People of Virginia", beginning Bacon's Rebellion against the rule of Governor William Berkeley.
Events.html: 1676 – Nathaniel Bacon issues the "Declaration of the People of Virginia", beginning Bacon's Rebellion against the rule of Governor William Berkeley.

Events.year: 1729 – Founding of Baltimore, Maryland.
Events.html: 1729 – Founding of Baltimore, Maryland.

Events.year: 1733 – The first Masonic Grand Lodge in the future United States is constituted in Massachusetts.
Events.html: 1733 – The first Masonic Grand Lodge in the future United States is constituted in Massachusetts.

Events.year: 1756 – In Saint Petersburg, Bartolomeo Rastrelli presents the newly built Catherine Palace to Empress Elizabeth and her courtiers.
Events.html: 1756 – In Saint Petersburg, Bartolomeo Rastrelli presents the newly built Catherine Palace to Empress Elizabeth and her courtiers.

Events.year: 1811 – Father Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, leader of the Mexican insurgency, is executed by the Spanish in Chihuahua City, Mexico.
Events.html: 1811 – Father Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, leader of the Mexican insurgency, is executed by the Spanish in Chihuahua City, Mexico.

Events.year: 1825 – Malden Island is discovered by captain George Byron, 7th Baron Byron.
Events.html: 1825 – Malden Island is discovered by captain George Byron, 7th Baron Byron.

Events.year: 1859 – First ascent of Grand Combin, one of the highest summits in the Alps.
Events.html: 1859 – First ascent of Grand Combin, one of the highest summits in the Alps.

Events.year: 1863 – American Indian Wars: Representatives of the United States and tribal leaders including Chief Pocatello (of the Shoshone)  sign the Treaty of Box Elder.
Events.html: 1863 – American Indian Wars: Representatives of the United States and tribal leaders including Chief Pocatello (of the Shoshone) sign the Treaty of Box Elder.

Events.year: 1864 – American Civil War: Battle of the Crater: Union forces attempt to break Confederate lines at Petersburg, Virginia by exploding a large bomb under their trenches.
Events.html: 1864 – American Civil War: Battle of the Crater: Union forces attempt to break Confederate lines at Petersburg, Virginia by exploding a large bomb under their trenches.

Events.year: 1865 – The steamboat Brother Jonathan sinks off the coast of Crescent City, California, killing 225 passengers, the deadliest shipwreck on the Pacific Coast of the U.S. at the time.
Events.html: 1865 – The steamboat Brother Jonathan sinks off the coast of Crescent City, California, killing 225 passengers, the deadliest shipwreck on the Pacific Coast of the U.S. at the time.

Events.year: 1866 – Armed Confederate veterans in New Orleans riot against a meeting of Radical Republicans, killing 48 people and injuring another 100.
Events.html: 1866 – Armed Confederate veterans in New Orleans riot against a meeting of Radical Republicans, killing 48 people and injuring another 100.

Events.year: 1871 – The Staten Island Ferry Westfield's boiler explodes, killing over 85 people.
Events.html: 1871 – The Staten Island Ferry Westfield's boiler explodes, killing over 85 people.

Events.year: 1912 – Japan's Emperor Meiji dies and is succeeded by his son Yoshihito, who is now known as the Emperor Taishō.
Events.html: 1912 – Japan's Emperor Meiji dies and is succeeded by his son Yoshihito, who is now known as the Emperor Taishō.

Events.year: 1930 – In Montevideo, Uruguay wins the first FIFA World Cup.
Events.html: 1930 – In Montevideo, Uruguay wins the first FIFA World Cup.

Events.year: 1932 – Premiere of Walt Disney's Flowers and Trees, the first cartoon short to use Technicolor and the first Academy Award winning cartoon short.
Events.html: 1932 – Premiere of Walt Disney's Flowers and Trees, the first cartoon short to use Technicolor and the first Academy Award winning cartoon short.

links.title: Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film

Events.year: 1945 – World War II: Japanese submarine I-58 sinks the USS Indianapolis, killing 883 seamen. Most die during the following four days, until an aircraft notices the survivors.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Japanese submarine I-58 sinks the USS Indianapolis, killing 883 seamen. Most die during the following four days, until an aircraft notices the survivors.

Events.year: 1956 – A joint resolution of the U.S. Congress is signed by President Dwight D. Eisenhower, authorizing In God We Trust as the U.S. national motto.
Events.html: 1956 – A joint resolution of the U.S. Congress is signed by President Dwight D. Eisenhower, authorizing In God We Trust as the U.S. national motto.

Events.year: 1962 – The Trans-Canada Highway, the longest national highway in the world, is officially opened.
Events.html: 1962 – The Trans-Canada Highway, the longest national highway in the world, is officially opened.

Events.year: 1965 – U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Social Security Act of 1965 into law, establishing Medicare and Medicaid.
Events.html: 1965 – U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Social Security Act of 1965 into law, establishing Medicare and Medicaid.

Events.year: 1966 – England defeats West Germany to win the 1966 FIFA World Cup at Wembley Stadium after extra time.
Events.html: 1966 – England defeats West Germany to win the 1966 FIFA World Cup at Wembley Stadium after extra time.

Events.year: 1969 – Vietnam War: US President Richard Nixon makes an unscheduled visit to South Vietnam and meets with President Nguyễn Văn Thiệu and U.S. military commanders.
Events.html: 1969 – Vietnam War: US President Richard Nixon makes an unscheduled visit to South Vietnam and meets with President Nguyễn Văn Thiệu and U.S. military commanders.

Events.year: 1971 – Apollo program: Apollo 15 Mission: David Scott and James Irwin on the Apollo Lunar Module Falcon land on the Moon with the first Lunar Rover.
Events.html: 1971 – Apollo program: Apollo 15 Mission: David Scott and James Irwin on the Apollo Lunar Module Falcon land on the Moon with the first Lunar Rover.

Events.year: 1971   – An All Nippon Airways Boeing 727 and a Japanese Air Force F-86 collide over Morioka, Iwate, Japan killing 162.
Events.html: 1971 – An All Nippon Airways Boeing 727 and a Japanese Air Force F-86 collide over Morioka, Iwate, Japan killing 162.

Events.year: 1974 – Watergate scandal: U.S. President Richard Nixon releases subpoenaed White House recordings after being ordered to do so by the Supreme Court of the United States.
Events.html: 1974 – Watergate scandal: U.S. President Richard Nixon releases subpoenaed White House recordings after being ordered to do so by the Supreme Court of the United States.

links.title: Supreme Court of the United States

Events.year: 1975 – Jimmy Hoffa disappears from the parking lot of the Machus Red Fox restaurant in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, a suburb of Detroit, at about 2:30 p.m. He is never seen or heard from again.
Events.html: 1975 – Jimmy Hoffa disappears from the parking lot of the Machus Red Fox restaurant in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, a suburb of Detroit, at about 2:30 p.m. He is never seen or heard from again.

Events.year: 1978 – The 730 (transport), Okinawa Prefecture changes its traffic on the right-hand side of the road to the left-hand side.
Events.html: 1978 – The 730 (transport), Okinawa Prefecture changes its traffic on the right-hand side of the road to the left-hand side.

Events.year: 1980 – Vanuatu gains independence.
Events.html: 1980 – Vanuatu gains independence.

Events.year: 1980   – Israel's Knesset passes the Jerusalem Law.
Events.html: 1980 – Israel's Knesset passes the Jerusalem Law.

Events.year: 1981 – As many as 50,000 demonstrators, mostly women and children, took to the streets in Łódź to protest food ration shortages in Communist Poland.
Events.html: 1981 – As many as 50,000 demonstrators, mostly women and children, took to the streets in Łódź to protest food ration shortages in Communist Poland.

Events.year: 1990 – Ian Gow, Conservative Member of Parliament, is assassinated at his home by IRA terrorists in a car bombing after he assured the group that the British government would never surrender to them.[1]
Events.html: 1990 – Ian Gow, Conservative Member of Parliament, is assassinated at his home by IRA terrorists in a car bombing after he assured the group that the British government would never surrender to them.[1]

Events.year: 2003 – In Mexico, the last 'old style' Volkswagen Beetle rolls off the assembly line.
Events.html: 2003 – In Mexico, the last 'old style' Volkswagen Beetle rolls off the assembly line.

Events.year: 2006 – The world's longest running music show Top of the Pops is broadcast for the last time on BBC Two. The show had aired for 42 years.
Events.html: 2006 – The world's longest running music show Top of the Pops is broadcast for the last time on BBC Two. The show had aired for 42 years.

Events.year: 2011 – Marriage of Queen Elizabeth II's eldest granddaughter  Zara Phillips to former rugby player Mike Tindall.
Events.html: 2011 – Marriage of Queen Elizabeth II's eldest granddaughter Zara Phillips to former rugby player Mike Tindall.

Events.year: 2012 – A train fire kills 32 passengers and injures 27 on the Tamil Nadu Express in Andhra Pradesh, India.
Events.html: 2012 – A train fire kills 32 passengers and injures 27 on the Tamil Nadu Express in Andhra Pradesh, India.

Events.year: 2012   – A power grid failure in Delhi leaves more than 300 million people without power in northern India.
Events.html: 2012 – A power grid failure in Delhi leaves more than 300 million people without power in northern India.

Events.year: 2014 – One hundred and fifty people are trapped after a landslide in Maharashtra, India; 20 are killed.
Events.html: 2014 – One hundred and fifty people are trapped after a landslide in Maharashtra, India; 20 are killed.
